title: Pasture in Normandy

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on panel.

publication_history:

exhibition_history:
San Francisco, California Palace of the Legion of Honor, Barbizon Revisited, September 27–November 4, 1962, cat. 105; travelled to Toledo Museum of Art, November 20–December 7, 1962; Cleveland Museum of Art, January 15–February 24, 1963; Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, March 14–April 28, 1963.

Washington, D.C., National Collection of Fine Arts, American Art in the Barbizon Mood, January 23–April 20, 1975, cat. 14.

Toyko, The Seibu Museum, Millet, Corot and the School of Barbizon, March 15–April 14, 1980, cat. T61; travelled to Hyogo, Japan, The Museum of Modern Art, April 19–May 18, 1980; Sapporo, Japan, The Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art, May 24–June 15, 1980; The Hiroshima Prefectural Museum, June 21–July 13, 1980; The Kitakyushu Municipal Museum, July 19–August 10, 1980.
provenance_text: Laurent-Richard, by 1886; his sale Galerie Georges Petit, Paris, May 28–29, 1886, lot 67 for 20,000 francs, sold to Galerie Georges Petit [price and buyer according to an annotated sale catalogue in the Rijksbureau voor Kunsthistorische Documentatie, The Hague]. Eugène Secrétan, by 1889; his sale Boussod, Valadon & Co., Paris and Charles Sedelmeyer, Paris, July 1, 1889, lot 79 for 31,500 francs to Durand-Ruel [price and buyer according to an annotated sale catalogue in the Rijksbureau voor Kunsthistorische Documentatie, The Hague]; Durand-Ruel. Henry Field (died 1890), Chicago; his widow Mrs. Florence Lathrop Field; given to the Art Institute, 1894.
